title: Easeout Weekly #36
body:
Frontend News aims to keep you updated with what's happening in the world of web dev! With the latest news and resources from the design & development community.
![Design work sample](/images/uploads/design-estimates.jpeg) [How to Estimate Design Work](https://uxdesign.cc/how-to-estimate-ux-design-254524e37f2b) Design is an iterative process and you don‚Äôt know at the beginning of a new project how many design iterations you need to go through, justify, negotiate and test until you arrive at an acceptable solution. In this article, we explore some of the pitfalls of cost estimations for digital product and service design. [Read it ‚û°Ô∏è](https://uxdesign.cc/how-to-estimate-ux-design-254524e37f2b)

Check out this project by Alper Gokcehan. [Check it out ‚û°Ô∏è](https://github.com/alperg/slack-vscode)
![Optimizing WordPress for Google PageSpeed Insights](/images/uploads/opt-wordpress.jpg) [Optimizing WordPress for Google PageSpeed Insights](https://3.7designs.co/blog/2021/01/optimizing-wordpress-for-google-pagespeed-insights-advanced-techniques/?utm_source=feedburner&utm_medium=feed&utm_campaign=Feed%3A+AnnArborWebDesignBlog-AnnArborWebDesignIdeas+%28Web+Design+%2B+Web+Strategy+-+Podcast+%2B+Blog%29) Speed is important. Users expect fast loading websites, and Google considers page performance as a ranking factor. Google Pagespeed or Lighthouse insights have received more attention over the years, especially now that Google has identified what they call ‚ÄúCore Web Vitals‚Äù as a future ranking signal. [Read it ‚û°Ô∏è](https://3.7designs.co/blog/2021/01/optimizing-wordpress-for-google-pagespeed-insights-advanced-techniques/?utm_source=feedburner&utm_medium=feed&utm_campaign=Feed%3A+AnnArborWebDesignBlog-AnnArborWebDesignIdeas+%28Web+Design+%2B+Web+Strategy+-+Podcast+%2B+Blog%29)

[Read it ‚û°Ô∏è](https://uxdesign.cc/21-tips-for-winning-the-worst-site-2021-award-5e3cee7f5551)
![Circle Colors](/images/uploads/circles-colors.png) [How to Play and Pause CSS Animations with CSS Custom Properties](https://css-tricks.com/how-to-play-and-pause-css-animations-with-css-custom-properties/) There is a CSS property specifically for controlling @keyframes animations, which can be controlled with JavaScript. This article shows you how to set it up! Hint: it involves CSS custom properties. [Read it ‚û°Ô∏è](https://css-tricks.com/how-to-play-and-pause-css-animations-with-css-custom-properties/)
![Alpine.js Logo](/images/uploads/alpinejs-logo.png) [Lightweight Form Validation with Alpine.js and Iodine.js](https://css-tricks.com/lightweight-form-validation-with-alpine-js-and-iodine-js/) [Alpine.js](https://github.com/alpinejs/alpine)¬†and¬†[Iodine.js](https://github.com/mattkingshott/iodine)¬†are two minimal JavaScript libraries we can use to create highly interactive forms with little technical debt and a negligible hit to our page-load time. Let's see how! [Read it ‚û°Ô∏è](https://css-tricks.com/lightweight-form-validation-with-alpine-js-and-iodine-js/)
![Atomic CSS](/images/uploads/atomic-css-pieces.jpg) [On Auto-Generated Atomic CSS](https://css-tricks.com/on-auto-generated-atomic-css/) A neat exploration of the idea of turning CSS into "Atomic" classes. [Read it ‚û°Ô∏è](https://css-tricks.com/on-auto-generated-atomic-css/)
![Web Design Trends 2021: The Report](/images/uploads/web-design-trends-report-2021.png) [Web Design Trends 2021: The Report](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2021/01/web-design-trends-report-2021/) 2020 was anything but normal. Consumers had their lives shaken up and many businesses experienced new challenges as well as opportunities thanks to the novel events of the year. [Read it ‚û°Ô∏è](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2021/01/web-design-trends-report-2021/)
![Flexible Components Example](/images/uploads/transparent-flexible.png) [Building Flexible Components With Transparency](https://cloudfour.com/thinks/building-flexible-components-with-transparency/) Paul Hebert shows us that adding a touch of transparency, we can design components that automatically adapt to their backgrounds. [Read it ‚û°Ô∏è](https://cloudfour.com/thinks/building-flexible-components-with-transparency/)
![Svelte and Spring Logos](/images/uploads/svelte-spring.jpg) [Svelte and Spring Animations](https://css-tricks.com/svelte-and-spring-animations/) Spring animations are a wonderful way to make UI interactions come to life. Rather than merely changing a property at a constant rate over a period of time, springs allow us to move things using spring physics, which gives the impression of a real thing moving, and can appear more natural to users. Let's see how to integrate Spring with Svelte! [Read it ‚û°Ô∏è](https://css-tricks.com/svelte-and-spring-animations/)
![How To Make More Money Selling Shopify Apps In 2021](/images/uploads/shopify-future-of-commerce-report.png) [How To Make More Money Selling Shopify Apps In 2021](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2021/01/selling-shopify-apps-2021/) Developing a Shopify app and being able to sell it are two different things. If you want to give merchants a reason to install and use your Shopify app, here are four things you need to do. [Read it ‚û°Ô∏è](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2021/01/selling-shopify-apps-2021/)

[Read it ‚û°Ô∏è](https://css-tricks.com/animating-with-lottie/)
